articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas on Wednesday said its "positive" response to a U.S. ceasefire plan for the eight-month-old war in the Gaza Strip opened a "wide pathway" to reach an agreement, but the outlook was uncertain as neither the Palestinian group nor Israel publicly committed to a deal.
articles.title: Hamas says it creates broad prospects for a ceasefire deal in Gaza

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: Both Israel and Hamas committed war crimes in the early stages of the Gaza war, a U.N. inquiry found on Wednesday, saying that Israel's actions also constituted crimes against humanity because of the immense civilian losses.
articles.title: 'Immense' scale of Gaza killings amount to crime against humanity, UN inquiry says

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden flies to Italy on Wednesday for meetings with Group of Seven leaders aimed at increasing pressure on Russia over its war against Ukraine and China for its support of Moscow and excess industrial capacity.
articles.title: Biden heads to G7 summit focused on Ukraine aid, China's support for Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A fire that broke out in a building housing workers in the city of Mangaf in southern Kuwait early on Wednesday has killed at least 41 people, the country's deputy prime minister Sheikh Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah said during a visit to the site.
articles.title: Fire in Kuwaiti building housing workers kills 41, deputy PM says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rwanda said the U.N. refugee agency had lied when the organisation told a British court this week that asylum seekers sent to the East African country could be moved on again to states where they risked torture or death.
articles.title: Rwanda says UN refugee agency lying in British asylum policy case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's conservative Republicans party was fraying on Wednesday after its leader called for an alliance between his party's candidates and Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally (RN) in a snap parliamentary election.
articles.title: France's conservative Republicans party fraying over potential far-right pact

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mass starvation is a "very real risk" in some regions of war-torn Sudan, where conflict has made medical aid broadly unavailable, the head of the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Mass starvation is 'very real risk' in some Sudan regions, WHO says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian ballistic missile strike on Ukraine's southern city of Kryvyi Rih on Wednesday killed at least eight people and injured another 21, including two children, officials said, with a further four people reported missing.
articles.title: Russian missile attack kills 8, injures 21 in Ukraine's Kryvyi Rih

articles.author: Bhargav Acharya, Nellie Peyton
articles.description: South Africa's Inkatha Freedom Party (IFP) will join a unity government with the African National Congress (ANC) and the Democratic Alliance (DA), it said on Wednesday, giving a strong indication of who will govern the country.
articles.title: South Africa's IFP says it will join ANC and DA in unity government

articles.author: Ahmed Mohamed Hassan, Andrew Mills
articles.description: Hamas wants written guarantees from the United States for a permanent ceasefire and withdrawal of Israeli forces from the Gaza Strip in order to sign off on a U.S.-backed truce proposal, two Egyptian security sources said.
articles.title: Hamas seeking US guarantees in Gaza ceasefire plan, sources say
